title: An Evening with Tammy Lee of Allstate Insurance Company & Bay Area Analytics
description:
R-Ladies and Bay Area Analytics (http://www.meetup.com/BayAreaAnalytics/) are teaming up to bring you a special evening with a Predictive Modeler with a background in Business Administration. What a perfect fit!

Tammy Lee is a Predictive Modeler at the Allstate Research and Planning Center down in Menlo Park. She works in the Analytics and Insights group with several other modelers with a variety of backgrounds; largely statistics, actuarial, business, and economics.

Tammy graduated with a double major in Statistics and Business Administration from the University of California, Berkeley, and a master’s degree in Statistics from Harvard University. She was an undergraduate student instructor for R at Berkeley and is proud to be a lady of R! In terms of continuing studies, she is very interested in data science and is a part of the Stanford Data Mining and Applications Graduate Certificate Program.

Her talk will be about how she and her group use predictive analytics to create business value for Allstate Insurance Company. She will talk about how the group is organized, what specific tools the group uses, and some of her analysis projects.

title: Let's meetup and work on our R projects
description: Many of us are working through Coursera's Data Analysis. Whatever your current project, come hang out while you code. We are looking for a location in SF - suggestions?

title: Let's get together and hack
description: Many of us are working on Coursera's Data Analysis, and the rest of us have interesting R projects. Let's hang out and make progress together!

title: Computing for Data Analysis (Week 4 - Final)
description:
This will be the last Meetup for the Coursera class "Computing for Data Analysis (http://www.coursera.org/course/compdata)".

The agenda will be the following:

• Do the quiz and assignment by yourself

• After submitting it online, get together in pairs or groups to discuss and compare answers

TIP: Try to watch the lectures (everything or part of it) beforehand so you can have more time to discuss your answers and learn more with other R-ladies.

Be sure to bring your laptop.

*We suggest a $5 donation as a way to thank SHARED for hosting us.

description:

Obs: If you missed weeks 2 and 3 you can still get involved. It is never too late!!

title: Computing for Data Analysis (Week 1)
description:
Hello R-ladies,

SHARED (http://shared-sf.com) is going to host us!!

The coursera class "Computing for Data Analysis (http://www.coursera.org/course/compdata)" will start on September 23rd.

We'll be meeting for 4 Saturdays (09/28, 10/05, 10/12 and 10/19) from 1pm to 7pm.

It is going to be a lot of fun!

I'd like to have some mentors and people to help me out. Please, email me at: gabkroz@gmail.com

Be sure to bring your laptop - we'll be working through the assignments together.

If you can't make it, please make sure to open your spot.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

WHAT: Computing for Data Analysis

WHEN: Four Saturdays (09/28, 10/05, 10/12 and 10/19) from 1pm to 7pm

WHERE: SHARED (http://shared-sf.com/)

*We are asking for a small donation as a way to thank SHARED for hosting us.

title: Saturday Open Hack
description:
For the next meetup (Saturday - July 27th) we are going to have a joint meeting with the Analytics Hackathon (http://www.meetup.com/Analytics-Hackathon/). This is going to be our first meetup in the East Bay.

Charles (from the Analytics Hackaton) is going to give a presentation on basic Portfolio Simulation in R. There will likely be an intro seminar for beginning R users.

If someone wants to give a talk about anything (something that you know or learned and want to share, some project you've been working on, etc) let me know.

So, let's meet for a few hours, to have fun while learning R, to exchange knowledge, to work on your personal projects or just to meet other R-ladies.

As always, I will provide online tutorials (links) and books so you can work on or you can bring your own book about R (that one that you bought but you never had time to sit and study it).

If you are an intermediate or advanced R user, you can work on your own project, study any topic you are interested in or help the beginners.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Bring your computer!

Install R: http://cran.cnr.berkeley.edu/

If you'd like to install RStudio too, the link is here: http://www.rstudio.com/ide/download/desktop

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We are asking for a donation ($10) so we can pay for the space. Check the space out:

http://www.portoffices.com/spaces/101-broadway/

Meet up opens at 10am. Goes until everyone wants to go home! (probably around 6pm)

title: R & Coffee
description:
Hello R-ladies,

It's time to get together again!

Let's meet on Monday - May 6th, for a few hours, to have fun while learning R, to exchange knowledge, to work on your personal projects or just to have coffee together and meet other R-ladies.

I will provide online tutorials (links) and books so you can work on or you can bring your own book about R (that one that you bought but you never had time to sit and study it).

If you are an intermediate or advanced R user, you can work on your own project, study any topic you are interested in or help the beginners.

Bring your computer!

Install R: http://cran.cnr.berkeley.edu/

If you'd like to install RStudio too, the link is here: http://www.rstudio.com/ide/download/desktop

P.S: This place has tables in the back too. So if you don't find us in the front, look for us in the back.

title: Tech in Motion SF Presents: Women in Engineering!
description:
Please RSVP here: http://www.meetup.com/TechinMotionSF/events/112869962/

Join us at San Francisco's 7th Tech in Motion event! RichRelevance (http://www.richrelevance.com/) will be opening their doors to techies in the area so that guests can meet and network with others of similar interest! Don't be discouraged by the event name! Everyone is welcome. Enjoy a free happy hour, along with some delicious snacks, while talking tech. Three guest speakers will follow, giving informative and inspirational talks as women who have excelled in their career paths.Workbridge Associates (http://www.workbridgeassociates.com/locations/san-francisco) and Jobspring Partners (http://www.jobspringpartners.com/locations/san-francisco) will be onsite to offer any career consulting advice or insight. We can't wait to see you there on Wednesday, April 24th! Please bring a friend! Make sure to follow us on twitter for updates, reminders, and live pictures on the meetup:@WorkbridgeSF (https://twitter.com/WorkbridgeSF) and @JobspringSF (https://twitter.com/JobspringSF).

Meet your speakers:

Gabriela de Queiroz (http://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=122680955&authType=NAME_SEARCH&authToken=r64L&locale=en_US&srchid=36339d30-2cda-4c82-b859-c16fca68eedd-0&srchindex=1&srchtotal=63&goback=.fps_PBCK_gabriela+de+queiroz_*1_*1_*1_*1_*1_*1_*2_*1_Y_*1_*1_*1_false_1_R_*1_*51_*1_*51_true_*2_*2_*2_*2_*2_*2_*2_*2_*2_*2_*2_*2_*2_*2_*2_*2_*2_*2_*2_*2_*2&pvs=ps&trk=pp_profile_name_link) is a statistician and the founder of R-ladies -- a group to promote R, exchange knowledge, and create a network among women. Using statistical tools (such as R), she is passionate about making beautiful things and telling stories with data. With this explosion in the availability of information, faster and more efficient tools are needed to extract meaningful patterns from data. She will introduce R, explain why it is so powerful, show some packages for visualizing and exploring large data sets, and give examples along with some applications.

Julia Grace (http://www.linkedin.com/in/juliagrace) was the first employee at Tindie (http://tindie.com/) ("Etsy for Hardware Hackers") where she is currently the engineering lead. Having an abundance of startup experience, she will share her knowledge with us. If you think your company's culture is "impromptu nerf gun fights and catered lunch", you're wrong. She will talk about what culture really is and how if you don't actively create it, it will be created for you.

Ruma Nair (http://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=29205527&locale=en_US&trk=tyah2) works as a software engineer at RichRelevance in the platform team. Her work includes solving fun problems like scaling the infrastructure, dabbling with "Big Data", and improving performance. Ruma will delve into Big Data.

title: R & Coffee
description:
Hello R-ladies,

It's time to get together again!
In this second meetup I'd like to do something more informal.
Let's meet in the Arlequin Cafe ( http://www.arlequincafe.com/ ) on Sunday - February 10th, for a few hours, to have fun while learning R, to exchange knowledge, to work on our personal projects or just to meet other R-ladies.

We will work on the introductory tutorial to the R language offered by the Code School in partnership with O'Reilly ( http://tryr.codeschool.com/ ).

If you are an intermediate or advanced R user, you can work on your own project, study any topic you are interested in or help the beginners.
